New Records: Anrich Nortje's 4 for 7 is his career-best figures.
Ottneil Baartman bowled 20 dot balls, the joint-most by a bowler in an innings at a T20 World Cup, equalling Ajantha Mendis against Zimbabwe in 2012.
Sri Lanka's total of 77 is their lowest in the T20 format.
Key Match Events: Anrich Nortje took 4 wickets for 7 runs.
Ottneil Baartman took a wicket with his first ball in a World Cup match.
Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller guided South Africa to victory with 22 balls to spare.
127 out of the 214 balls faced by the batters in this game were dots, the most dots in a Men's T20 World Cup game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the first official T20I played at the newly-created stadium at Eisenhower Park.
The surface was tricky to bat on with inconsistent bounce and big square boundaries.
